  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public void addTask(String title, String description, String date, Integer priority)
      The addTask function adds a new task to the agenda with the given title, description, date, and priority, and saves the state of the agenda.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task that you want to add. It is a string value.
      description - The description parameter is a String that represents the description of the task. It provides additional information or details about the task.
      date - The "date" parameter is a string that represents the date of the task. It could be in any format that is suitable for your application, such as "yyyy-MM-dd" or "MM/dd/yyyy".
      priority - The priority parameter is an Integer that represents the priority level of the task. It is used to determine the importance or urgency of the task.

    • removeTask

      public String removeTask(Integer option) throws exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid
      The function removes a task from the agenda based on the given option and returns a message indicating the task that was removed.
      Parameters:
      option - The "option" parameter is an Integer that represents the type of task to be removed. If the value is 1, it indicates a priority task, and if the value is 2, it indicates a non-priority task.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String value.
      Throws:
      exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid

    • modifyTask

      public void modifyTask(Integer id, String title, String description, String date, Integer priority) throws exceptions.exceptionTheObjectDoesntExist, exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid
      The function modifies a task in an agenda by updating its title, description, date, and priority, and saves the state of the modification.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the task that needs to be modified.
      title - The title of the task to be modified.
      description - The "description" parameter is a String that represents the updated description of the task.
      date - The "date" parameter is a string that represents the date of the task. It could be in any format that is suitable for your application, such as "yyyy-MM-dd" or "MM/dd/yyyy".
      priority - The priority parameter is an Integer that represents the priority level of the task. It is used to indicate the importance or urgency of the task.
      Throws:
      exceptions.exceptionTheObjectDoesntExist
      exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid

    • searchTask

      public Task searchTask(Integer id) throws exceptions.exceptionTheObjectDoesntExist, exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid
      The function searches for a task with a given ID in an agenda and returns it.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is an Integer that represents the unique identifier of the task that you want to search for.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Task object.
      Throws:
      exceptions.exceptionTheObjectDoesntExist
      exceptions.exceptionThisDataStructureIsVoid

    • showTasks

      public String showTasks()
      The function "showTasks" returns a string representation of the agenda.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the value of the variable "agenda" followed by a new line character.

    • undo

      public String undo()
      The function "undo" pops the top element from the undoStack and sets the agenda to the new top element, returning a message indicating the change that was undone.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message.
